title: French Onion Soup
instructions: Heat butter and olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add sliced onions and cook, stirring often, until caramelized, about 25-30 minutes.
Add garlic, thyme, and bay leaves, and cook for another minute.
Pour in the white wine, scraping the bottom of the pot, and let it reduce by half.
Add beef broth, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
Remove bay leaves and season with salt and pepper.
Ladle the soup into bowls, top with toasted baguette slices, and sprinkle with Gruyère cheese.
Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly, then serve hot.
